extracted_data_phrases: in regard to their rightful authority
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents in regard to their rightful authority, especially when they offered guidance or directives that would have benefited me?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when frustrated by those who share my faith, yet struggle to live it?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I skip obligatory days such as Ash Wednesday, failing to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I, through my actions and attitudes, dishonored my mother?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

extracted_data_phrases: through my attitudes , words , and deeds
disobedience.question: Have I dishonored my mother and father through my attitudes, words, and deeds?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

disobedience.question: Have I, through my actions and attitudes, disobeyed the authority given to me by God for my mother and father?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics to believe it is acceptable to stay away from Sacraments or Mass, through my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by saying nothing to them about missing Mass or Sacraments
condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics astray by saying nothing to them about missing Mass or Sacraments?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from participation in sacraments , such as Mass
condoning.question: Did I lead fellow Catholics away from participation in sacraments, such as Mass, through my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by avoiding a difficult conversation , perhaps out of fear or discomfort
perhaps out of fear or discomfort
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to continue in error by avoiding a difficult conversation, perhaps out of fear or discomfort?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where a loved one's remains were scattered instead of buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: through my silence or lack of opposition
condoning.question: Did I condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church through my silence or lack of opposition?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval, through words, to another Catholic who was considering marrying outside of the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: through words to another Catholic who chose to marry outside the Church
to another Catholic who chose to marry outside the Church

condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

on their occupation , nationality , or other characteristics that are beyond their control

uncharity.question: Did I let my own interests overshadow the needs and well-being of those around me?

sensuality.description: This sin makes  idol of physical or emotional gratification, turning what should be a gift from God into the primary focus of one's life, displacing God as the center and highest good.

scandal.question: Did I try to lead someone else into doing something sinful?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

extracted_data_phrases: into doing something that would be considered sinful
scandal.question: Did I try to lead someone else into doing something that would be considered sinful, causing them to stray from God's will?

impenitence.question: Have I refused to admit my wrongdoing, even in my thoughts, when confronted with my own sinful behavior?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

for someone in my community who was ill
callousness.question: Did I turn away from caring for someone in my community who was ill?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of serious personal turmoil
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of serious personal turmoil?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of grave sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of grave sin, causing harm to God's presence within me?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.question: Have I spoken the name of God disrespectfully in conversation, using it as a byword or curse?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: not in reverence but as a careless expression

blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that were driven by pride rather than humility
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence my relationships, career decisions, and treatment of others in ways that were driven by pride rather than humility?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: especially in situations where I had control over decisions or outcomes
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence my relationships, especially in situations where I had control over decisions or outcomes?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated sensual acts outside of marriage?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: solely to my own efforts and abilities
autonomy.question: Did I attribute the good things in my life solely to my own efforts and abilities, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: in every aspect of my activities
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's role in my daily life, forgetting to acknowledge His presence and providence in every aspect of my activities?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: without acknowledging God 's role in shaping me
autonomy.question: Did I solely rely on my own abilities without acknowledging God's role in shaping me?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

autonomy.question: Did I solely rely on my own abilities, attempting to orchestrate life's challenges without seeking God's guidance?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

envy.question: Have I envied others' blessings, especially when they seem to have more success or happiness than me?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I envied others' possessions and fixated on coveting what they have?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Have you, in your eating or drinking, overindulged beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I perform work on a Sunday, even though it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

sorcery.question: Have you interacted with mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards, seeking guidance through forbidden means rather than trusting in God's providence?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change
presumption.question: Did you presume God's mercy without making any effort to change, counting on His forgiveness despite persisting in sinful behavior?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of serious offense

presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

resistance of truth.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

extracted_data_phrases: either internally through private thoughts or to others in conversation

apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
